raw_text:
Oasis star fined for German brawl
 
 Oasis singer Liam Gallagher has been fined 50,000 euros (£35,000) after a fight in a German hotel two years ago.
 
 Gallagher was arrested along with drummer Alan White and three other members of the band's entourage after the brawl in Munich in December 2002. The band said they were victims of an "unprovoked attack" in a nightclub. But police said Gallagher kicked an officer in the chest and had large amounts of alcohol and drugs - possibly cocaine - in his blood. Gallagher lost two front teeth in the fight, which led to the band abandoning their German tour. His brother and bandmate Noel was in bed at the time.
 
 "The process has stopped by paying 50,000 euros," said Anton Winkler, spokesman for the Munich prosecutor. At the time, police said a "physical altercation" broke out among the musicians at about 0200 local time. That led to one of the group being "jostled" and falling onto the table of five Italian guests - causing the fight, they said. The fight continued outside, where "one of the officers was kicked in the chest with full force by Liam Gallagher... and suffered minor injuries", they said.
llama3.2:1b: Liam Gallagher, an Oasis singer, has been fined 50,000 euros (£35,000) for a brawl he allegedly committed in Munich, Germany two years ago. The incident occurred in a nightclub and involved police arresting him, drummer Alan White, and several members of the band's entourage.
llama3.2:3b: Liam Gallagher has been fined 50,000 euros for a brawl in Munich hotel in December 2002, where he allegedly kicked an officer in the chest, had large amounts of alcohol and drugs in his blood, and lost two front teeth. The incident led to the band abandoning their German tour.
gemma2:2b: Liam Gallagher has been fined 50,000 euros for a brawl in a German hotel two years ago. He was arrested alongside other members of his entourage after an altercation, during which he allegedly kicked an officer in the chest and exhibited signs of drug use. The fight led to the band abandoning their tour in Germany, as they were said to be victims of an unprovoked attack by another group.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Oasis singer Liam Gallagher, along with his bandmates Alan White and Noel, were fined 50,000 euros for a brawl that occurred in Germany two years earlier. The fight broke out at a nightclub where the band was performing, resulting in multiple injuries including blood alcohol intoxication and a physical altercation involving Gallagher.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Oasis singer Liam Gallagher has been fined 50,000 euros for a brawl in Munich two years ago that led to his band's cancellation of their tour. He faced charges of assault on an officer and drug possession after allegedly kicking him and having alcohol and drugs on him at the time.
qwen2.5:3b: Oasis singer Liam Gallagher fined 50,000 euros for a 2002 brawl in Munich; he lost two front teeth and hit an officer in the chest. The band claimed self-defense but was found intoxicated with drugs; as a result, the tour was canceled. Winkler, Munich prosecutor's spokesman, confirmed the process stopped by paying the fine. Police initially stated Gallagher pushed another musician who then fell onto Italian guests, starting the fight.

Oasis singer Liam Gallagher has been fined 50,000 euros (£35,000) after a German brawl in Munich in December 2002.
The process has stopped by paying 50,000 euros. One of the group being jostled and falling onto the table of five Italian guests causes the fight.
smollm:1.7b: Oasis star fined for German brawl

Oasis singer Liam Gallagher was fined 50,000 euros for a fight in Munich two years ago after a German attack involving his drummer Alan White and three other members of their enourage. The fight caused them to abandon their German tour and they returned to Germany. During the incident, they were hit with alcohol and drugs, possibly cocaine. One member sustained large amounts of blood, possibly from an unprovoked attack, and was fined for breaking into a five-ounce glass bottle. A physical altercation occurred around midnight local time, leading to some members being jostled and one fallen on a table. Another officer was kicked in the chest while another musician fell onto the table outside. The fine stopped the case after payment by Munich's prosecutor Anton Winkler.
tinyllama:1.1b: Summary: Oasis singer Liam Gallagher has been fined 50,000 euro (approximately £35,000) after a fight in a German hotel two years ago. The band said they were victims of an "unprovoked attack", but police found Gallaghers had large amounts of alcohol and drugs in his blood. He lost two front teeth in the fight, which ended with the band abandoning their German tour. Police paid 50,000 euro (approximately £35,000) to settle the case.

During the incident, he was arrested along with drummer Alan White and three other band members, who were charged with an "unprovoked attack" in a nightclub. The fight led to the cancellation of the German tour for Oasis, which included concerts in Munich. However, Noel Gallagher was in bed at the time.

This incident led to the cancellation of their German tour, as Gallagher's brother was injured during the altercation.
